author: benjaminion
content: Can anyone remind me why we store 65536 past randao mixes in the state? (0.8 years worth) I thought it was something about the weak subjectivity period, but that seems to be only a couple of weeks. This amounts to 2mb of data, which is quite chunky.

author: benjaminion
content: Ah, I think this helps : https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/pull/1109 "so that historical committees to be recomputed (e.g. for attester slashings)." I was forgetting that the validator records have enough info in them to allow past lists of active validators to be reconstructed, so committees can be reconstituted.
